movies.title: Berserk: The Golden Age Arc II - The Battle for Doldrey
movies.originalTitle: Beruseruku: Ougon jidai-hen II - dorudorei koryaku
movies.plot: For three years, Guts believed his mission was to pursue Griffith's dream together with him. But in order to become Griffith's equal and truly be called his friend, Guts realizes he will have to leave the Band of the Hawk. At the same time, a bloody battle to capture the impenetrable Fortress of Doldrey from the Empire of Chuder is about to begin. The Band of the Hawk will face an army 30,000 strong!
movies.simplePlot: For three years, Guts believed his mission was to pursue Griffith's dream together with him. But in order to become Griffith's equal and truly be called his friend, Guts realizes he will ...

biography.bio: Carrie Keranen was born on January 16, 1976 in Oak Park, Michigan, USA as Carrie Beth Keranen. She is known for her work on Fringe (2008), Mr. Pickles (2013) and Miraculous: Tales of Ladybug & Cat Noir (2015).
biography.name: Carrie Keranen

biography.bio: Orion Acaba was born on October 14, 1980 in Hollywood, California, USA. He is known for his work on The LEGO Movie Videogame (2014), Pillars of Eternity (2015) and Uncharted 4: A Thief's End (2016).
biography.name: Orion Acaba

biography.bio: Chris Jai Alex is from Lansing, Michigan. Chris was Literally born into music, his mother Gloria Sanford, was an aspiring artist since before his birth. With the exception of minor success and a star search appearance, she remained undiscovered. As the years passed she turned her attention over to her sons in hopes of realizing that ultimate dream nearly two generations old. Chris Jai showed promise, having a knack for creativity he taught himself piano, guitar, and midi music production. Later on he produced and preformed with a series of groups, the last and best being Mirage. Mirage had local success, they performed at local venues, one of which was with Boys II Men's, Wanya Morris. With Gloria's passing shortly before Mirage forming, she unfortunately never got to see or hear this group. After graduating from high school he moved to New York for a career in music production under the tutelage of the head director of membership for ASCAP and road manager for def jam recording artist CASE...it didn't work out. He returned to Michigan, shortly after Chris Jai and brother Seyque started the indie record label Phineqx Entertainment (PE). Phineqx Entertainment to this day remains the most successful record label in the history of Lansing, Michigan. The 1st release entitled "PE 2003" sold over 4000 copies and various PE mix tapes sold well over 47,000 copies. Along with the other members of Phineqx, he has since relocated to Los Angeles, CA, where they continue making music, being heard underground on a international level, if that makes any sense... Being an avid hobbyist he taught himself Japanese. After watching X-men 2 he was inspired to move to LA in hopes of "blowuptuating". He and four friends crammed their belongings in 2 cars and drove 72 hours to Cali where they shared a 1-room apartment on Hollywood Blvd for a year. Later Chris moved out with Sachiko Ishida. Shortly after his arrival in LA he began studying martial arts informally at LA Valley College, there he was introduced to martial art acting, and stunts where he found himself training with world class athletes, one of which was Wayne Daglish, a fellow film maker and frequent collaborator. After a while he picked up tips and made friends with a top Hollywood stuntman. He eventually started training at the world renowned 8711 under Chad Stahelkshi, whose group was responsible for bringing their magic to films such as The matrix series, 300, V for Vendetta, along with many other A+ Hollywood blockbusters. Later Chris Jai signed with Osbrink Agency for Voice Over and continues to voice video games and animation along with animating some characters with his movement via motion capture technology. He continues to perfect his craft and is currently learning 3 other languages simultaneously and completed 2 feature length scripts which are being pitched as you read. He continues to act in, make and score his own films as well as many other outside projects.
biography.name: Chris Jai Alex

biography.bio: G.K. Bowes was born in Tahiti, French Polynesia as Gina Keali'inohomoku Bowes. She is known for her work on Happily N'Ever After 2 (2009), Resident Evil 5 (2009) and Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain (2015).
biography.name: G.K. Bowes

biography.bio: Kevin T. Collins is an actor and director, known for Berserk: The Golden Age Arc I - The Egg of the King (2012), Berserk: The Golden Age Arc III - The Advent (2013) and Detachment (2011).
biography.name: Kevin T. Collins

biography.bio: The very talented voice actor, Marc Diraison, started voicing characters in anime that was being dubbed in New York City in early 2000s. He has since given his voice to many characters in anime and other animated shows. In addition to that, he has also directed and written scripts for several anime dubs. A favorite of the fans for over a decade and praised for his performance as Guts, the protagonist of Berserk anime series and movies. In 2013, he relocated to Los Angeles, where he continues to grace anime dubs with his voice, as well as voicing in several video games.
biography.name: Marc Diraison

biography.bio: Doug Erholtz was born on February 21, 1971 as Douglas J. Erholtz. He is known for his work on Digimon: Digital Monsters (1999), Patlabor: The Movie (1989) and Patlabor 2: The Movie (1993).
biography.name: Doug Erholtz

biography.bio: Gene Freeman is known for his work on Metallica: Spit Out the Bone (2016), Lobo and Berserk: The Golden Age Arc II - The Battle for Doldrey (2012).
biography.name: Gene Freeman

biography.bio: Takahiro Fujiwara is an actor, known for Frozen (2013), Berserk: The Golden Age Arc I - The Egg of the King (2012) and Berserk: The Golden Age Arc III - The Advent (2013).
biography.name: Takahiro Fujiwara

biography.bio: Hiroaki Iwanaga was born on November 23, 1979 in Nagasaki, Nagasaki, Japan. He is an actor, known for Berserk: The Golden Age Arc I - The Egg of the King (2012), Berserk: The Golden Age Arc III - The Advent (2013) and Uchuu Keiji Shaider Next Generation (2014).
biography.name: Hiroaki Iwanaga

biography.bio: Yuki Kaji was born on September 3, 1985 in Tokyo, Japan. He is an actor, known for Attack on Titan (2013), Guilty Crown (2011) and Berserk: The Golden Age Arc I - The Egg of the King (2012).
biography.name: Yuki Kaji

biography.bio: Minako Kotobuki was born on September 17, 1991 in Kobe, Hyogo, Japan. She is an actress, known for K-On! (2009), Berserk: The Golden Age Arc I - The Egg of the King (2012) and Doubutsu Sentai Zyuohger (2016).
biography.name: Minako Kotobuki

biography.bio: Rikiya Koyama was born on December 18, 1963 in Kyoto, Japan. He is an actor, known for Naruto: Shippûden (2007), Cowboy Bebop: The Movie (2001) and Utawarerumono (2006).
biography.name: Rikiya Koyama

biography.bio: Steve Kramer was born on December 24, 1950 in San Juan Capistrano, California, USA as Steven Mark Kramer. He is an actor and writer, known for Chronicle (2012), Akira (1988) and End of Days (1999).
biography.name: Steve Kramer

biography.bio: Christopher Kromer is an actor, known for Berserk (1997), Yu-Gi-Oh! Zexal (2011) and Berserk: The Golden Age Arc I - The Egg of the King (2012).
biography.name: Christopher Kromer
